intro: Flaveria angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Flaveria angustifolia is often used in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in supporting pollinators.
